definition: to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

sentences.english: The critics hated the movie, but we loved it.
sentences.chinese: 影评家们讨厌那部电影，但我们却很喜欢它。

sentences.english: The underneath is the standpoint that the water demon takes a wide view some movie review a collection editor.
sentences.chinese: 下面是水妖纵观一些影评搜集编辑的观点。

sentences.english: The film was rubbished by the critics.
sentences.chinese: 影评家把这部影片贬得一无是处。

sentences.english: Movie reviews often mislead the audience.
I haven"t time to see the film-----besides, it"s had dreadful reviews.
sentences.chinese: 我没有时间去看这部影片，再说，影评也诸多贬斥。

sentences.english: Critics who are guided by money are pathetic.
sentences.chinese: 被钱牵着鼻子走的影评人真是悲哀。

sentences.english: I hadn't seen any previews, nor had I read any reviews.
sentences.chinese: 我既没有看过电影预告片，也没有读过任何影评。

sentences.english: The film Mr. Bean was a box-office success, but it was not much praised by the critics.
sentences.chinese: 电影豆子先生是一部大卖片，不过影评差强人意。

sentences.english: The film was well-received by many critics.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影受到许多影评家的好评。

sentences.english: Please try to post only articles related to Sun Shang Xiang.
sentences.chinese: 请尽量只贴有关孙尚香的影评文章。

definition: impression or feeling after visiting or watching (movies, museums etc)
cotyledon of a bean (i.e. either of the halves of a bean seed that can be split apart after removing the seed coat)/thick bean sauce (abbr. for 豆瓣醬|豆瓣酱[dou4 ban4 jiang4])
to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
